001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util;
007
008import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Owning;
009
010import java.io.FilterOutputStream;
011import java.io.IOException;
012import java.io.OutputStream;
013
014import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
015import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressFBWarnings;
016
017/**
018 * Wraps a resource to make it {@link AutoCloseable}.
019 *
020 * @param <T>
021 *          the resource type
022 * @param <E>
023 *          the exception type that may be thrown if an error occurs when
024 *          closing the resource
025 */
026public final class AutoCloser<T, E extends Exception> implements AutoCloseable {
027  @NonNull
028  private final T resource;
029  @NonNull
030  private final Closer<T, E> closeLambda;
031
032  /**
033   * Adapt the the provided {@code resource} to be {@link AutoCloseable}, using a
034   * provided closer {@code lambda}.
035   *
036   * @param <T>
037   *          the resource's type
038   * @param <E>
039   *          the exception type that can be thrown when closing
040   * @param resource
041   *          the object to adapt
042   * @param lambda
043   *          the lambda to use as a callback on close
044   * @return the resource wrapped in an {@link AutoCloseable}
045   */
046  @Owning
047  @NonNull
048  public static <T, E extends Exception> AutoCloser<T, E> autoClose(
049      @NonNull T resource,
050      @NonNull Closer<T, E> lambda) {
051    return new AutoCloser<>(resource, lambda);
052  }
053
054  /**
055   * Adapt the provided {@code resource} to be {@link AutoCloseable}, using a
056   * provided closer {@code lambda}.
057   *
058   * @param resource
059   *          the object to adapt
060   * @param lambda
061   *          the lambda to use as a callback on close
062   */
063  private AutoCloser(@NonNull T resource, @NonNull Closer<T, E> lambda) {
064    this.resource = resource;
065    this.closeLambda = lambda;
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Get the wrapped resource.
070   *
071   * @return the resource object
072   */
073  @NonNull
074  public T getResource() {
075    return resource;
076  }
077
078  @Override
079  @SuppressFBWarnings("THROWS_METHOD_THROWS_CLAUSE_BASIC_EXCEPTION")
080  public void close() throws E {
081    closeLambda.close(getResource());
082  }
083
084  @FunctionalInterface
085  public interface Closer<T, E extends Exception> {
086    /**
087     * This method is called to auto-close the resource.
088     *
089     * @param object
090     *          the resource to auto-close
091     * @throws E
092     *           the exception type that can be thrown when closing
093     */
094    @SuppressFBWarnings("THROWS_METHOD_THROWS_CLAUSE_BASIC_EXCEPTION")
095    void close(@NonNull T object) throws E;
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Wraps the provided output stream to prevent the wrapped stream from being
100   * closed.
101   * <p>
102   * This is useful for protecting standard streams. i.e. {@link System#out},
103   * {@link System#err}.
104   *
105   * @param out
106   *          the stream to wrap
107   * @return the new wrapped stream
108   */
109  @Owning
110  @NonNull
111  public static OutputStream preventClose(OutputStream out) {
112    return new ClosePreventingOutputStream(out);
113  }
114
115  private static class ClosePreventingOutputStream
116      extends FilterOutputStream {
117
118    public ClosePreventingOutputStream(OutputStream out) {
119      super(out);
120    }
121
122    @Override
123    public void close() throws IOException {
124      // do nothing
125    }
126  }
127}
